Experts project that the expanded Child Tax Credit could potentially help lift one-half of all children out of poverty if all eligible families sign up to receive the monthly payments.

Roughly 39 million households ‚Äî covering 90 percent of children in the United States ‚Äî are slated to begin receiving monthly payments without any further action required. Other eligible families can still signup to receive monthly Child Tax Credit payments beginning this summer.
In 2021, for most families, the Child Tax Credit is increased to $3,000 for each child between 6 and 17 years old and to $3,600 for each child under age 6.
The American Rescue Plan delivered major tax relief for working families with children through a historic expansion of the Child Tax Credit, no thanks to a single Republican in Congress.

The Biden-Harris administration announced that today will be Child Tax Credit Awareness Day‚Äîa day of action to get the word out far and wide on the upcoming monthly payments that will benefit nearly all families.

The long-term implications for the CTC are enormous. In April, I sent a letter to @POTUS encouraging him to support making the tax credit permanent ‚Äî so that we can keep up this progress and support the 5 million kids who will still experience poverty. https://sarajacobs.house.gov/uploadedfiles/freshmen_letter_to_president_biden_on_expanded_child_tax_credit_042621.pdf http://pbs.twimg.com/media/E4a8DcaWQAEmTTk.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/E4a8FLWWQAQlcQ9.jpg

In #CA53, more than 148,000 kids live in households that will receive the Child Tax Credit ‚Äî that‚Äôs 84% of all the kids in our district. 

44,600 households will receive an average benefit of $2,900. That‚Äôs 12,400 kids who will no longer experience poverty.
Nationwide, the expanded Child Tax Credit is projected to cut childhood poverty in half, lifting 5 million American children out of poverty.

If you filed your 2020 taxes, you don‚Äôt have to do anything to apply. And for the families that didn‚Äôt file a 2020 tax return, the IRS created a non-filer tool that will automatically determine your eligibility and get you set up to receive the payments. https://www.irs.gov/credits-deductions/child-tax-credit-non-filer-sign-up-tool
Now, starting next month, families across the country will start receiving monthly payments directly into their bank accounts or mailboxes ‚Äî up to $300 per child per month.

The #ChildTaxCredit means a tax cut for working families all across the country. As Jeffrey Hoehn of @CLNkids said, ‚ÄúSingle mothers know where every penny goes. They just don‚Äôt have enough pennies to go around.‚Äù That goes for so many working parents in #CA53.

We say ‚Äúexpanded and improved‚Äù because we increased the CTC from $2,000 up to $3,000 per kid per year ‚Äî and up to $3,600 per kid under 6. And we also made sure more lower-income families are eligible.

After I was elected, I fought to have the expanded and improved #ChildTaxCredit included in the final package of the American Rescue Plan because of the huge impact it would have for families with kids.

In San Diego, for all the Fortune 500 companies and mansions on the beach, we also had more than 40% of kids living in households experiencing poverty. That‚Äôs unacceptable. And that was before the pandemic.

As many of you know, one of my top priorities in Congress is ending childhood poverty. Before I was elected, I founded a non-profit coalition dedicating to ending the experience of child poverty in San Diego County.

7 yrs ago, he walked me down the aisle at my wedding. Today, he & his son in law, (also a Cancerian) laugh often & deeply with one another, so do we. To those in estranged relationships, know that, healing & forgiveness are possible... and glorious, too!
But he never stopped trying to reach me, writing me, sending me books, informing my love of literature, poetry & my Black consciousnes. He made sure I knew that I was loved & missed.

Today, when I phoned him, I called him Dad. For years, I called him by his first name & celebrated my Mom on Mother's and Father's Day. Grace, his sobriety & time have allowed us to heal. When he was absent & unhealthy, I both missed & resented him.
